page.title: 17VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The Village Hall is about 61 years old and the land was leased for 99 years. The first hall was a hut moved from Boreham air-field. At the end of World War I a fund was set up to reinforce the hall. The land next to it was bought as a memorial garden. It is now a car- park. The hall is run by a management committee. Jackie Copsey is the secretary, and has been so for about six years. Many local clubs use the facilities at the hall. There is a weekly Youth Club and a twice monthly over-50s club called 'The Good Companions'. There is a Village Society which holds monthly bingo sessions and a 200 Club lottery, raising money for hall improvements. It has recently had a new ceiling, and other re-decorations.
